item.title: FHA vs Conventional Loans for First-Time Buyers 2025: Which Saves You More Money?
item.description:
FHA vs Conventional Loans: The Ultimate First-Time Buyer Decision Guide

Ask ten first-time buyers which loan type they should choose, and eight will guess wrong. That’s because the FHA versus conventional decision isn’t about which is universally betterâ€”it’s about which costs less money over your specific ownership period given your credit score, down payment amount, and how long you plan to keep the loan.

Most buyers make this choice based on down payment requirements alone, completely ignoring mortgage insurance costs that can differ by $30,000-$50,000 over the loan life. Let me show you exactly how to analyze both options so you choose the loan type that maximizes your financial position.
